resources.string: A historical American coastal star-shaped fort best known for its role in the War of 1812.
With close to 20,000 animals the National Aquarium was named one of the best aquariums in the United States.
Visit distinct environments that allow the display of plants from all over the world.
Located in an old cannery, the museum has exhibits on various types of manufacturing and industry from the early 20th century.
Popular pit-beef outlet serving namesake sandwiches and homestyle sides in a strip-club parking lot.
Huge, jumbo-lump crab cakes and raw oysters in a standing-room-only space
Old factory turned hip, rustic-chic place for refined New American fare with a farm-to-table bent.
Modern butchery and restaurant serving wood-fired, locally sourced BBQ, craft beers and cocktails.
Seafood-centric pub fare and tropical cocktails served a rustic, open-air setup on the harbor.
Elegant, retro bar at the top of the Belvedere Hotel offering views of the city and live dance music.
Relaxed taproom featuring craft beer and rotating food trucks plus free brewery tours every Saturday.
Simple local microbrewery featuring free tours, a beer-centric taproom, events and other activities.
Bicycling to celebrate and cultivate engagement in Baltimore.
Amphibious, human powered works of art custom built for a race.
900 Druid Park Lake Dr, Baltimore, MD
Featuring the best in national and regional talent along with a day full of world-class music, food and drinks.
The Festival is an ALL-YOU-CARE-TO-TASTE extravaganza complete with over 30,000 crabs, lots of beer, arts and crafts, live music, family fun and so much more!
